attributes.action: Ensure the safety of Afghans NOW
attributes.additional_details:
As you know, since the US forces withdrawal from Afghanistan, Taliban terror has taken control over the country: putting millions of Afghan lives at risk and forcing many to seek refuge abroad. 

Afghan lives, particularly those of women, ethnic and religious minority groups (including the Shia’ Hazara community), journalists, academics and those who have aided US-UK efforts in Afghanistan are in grave danger.
attributes.background:
Safely evacuate 50.000 Afghan nationals who wish to leave the country, in a period of 4 months.
Provide humanitarian aid for those left back. Prioritise women and children.
Work with Allies (UN, NATO) to tackle the issue.
Ensure the UK won't do any harm under the name of exporting democracy.

rejection.details:
We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Help the people of Afghanistan: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/594723

Increase the number of Afghan refugees the UK will welcome: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/595479

Redeploy UK Forces to Afghanistan to protect the citizens against the Taliban: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/594823
